X. Eileen Pan

Main navigation

Hi there! I am Eileen and I am a PhD student in pure mathematics with a focus in algebra, in particular group theory.

September 25, 2022

2022 theatre

By Eileen Pan in logs
  1. A Fight Against… (Una Lucha Contra…), by Pablo Manzi. Translated by William Gregory. 15 January, at Jerwood Theatre Upstairs
  2. The Glow, by Alistair McDowall. 5 February, at Jerwood Theatre Downstairs
  3. Purple Snowflakes and Witty Wanks, written and performed by Sarah Hanly. 5 February, at Jerwood Theatre Downstairs
  4. A Tale of Two Cities, by Lost Dog. 16 February, at Warwick Arts Centre
  5. A Number, by Carol Churchill. 19 March, at The Old Vic
  6. The Burnt City, by PunchDrunk. 10 April
  7. Prima Facie, by Suzie Miller, performed by Jodie Comer. 18 April, at Harold Pinter.
  8. The Burnt City, by PunchDrunk. 24 April
  9. The Burnt City, by PunchDrunk. 14 May
  10. Spirit Hole, written and performed by Simon Amstell. 15 May, at Warwick Arts Centre
  11. The Burnt City, by PunchDrunk. 21 May
  12. The Burnt City, by PunchDrunk. 22 May
  13. Concert by Hania Rani. 27 May, at KoKo
  14. The Wedding, by Gecko. 7 June, at Barbican Centre
  15. This Is Not Who I Am, by Dave Davidson (actually, Lucy Kirkwood). 18 June, at Jerwood Theatre Downstairs
  16. The Burnt City, by PunchDrunk. 19 June
  17. THE GODS THE GODS THE GODS, by Grainger & Wright. 24 June at The Streatham Space Project
  18. Miin: Body to Body, by Collective-A. 25 June, at The Place
  19. The Burnt City, by PunchDrunk. 3 July.
  20. The Burnt City, by PunchDrunk. 24 July.
  21. The Mousetrap, 70th anniversary production. 17 September, at St. Martin’s Theatre.
  22. The Apology, by Kyo Choi, directed by Ria Parry. 24 September, at The Arcola Theatre.
